verses.verse: A Prayer of Moses the man of God. Lord <S%H136><s%>, thou hast been our dwelling-place <S%H4583><s%> In all <S%H1755><s%> generations <S%H1755><s%>.

Before the mountains <S%H2022><s%> were brought forth <S%H3205><s%>, Or ever thou hadst formed <S%H2342><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> and the world <S%H8398><s%>, Even from everlasting <S%H5769><s%> to <S%H5704><s%> everlasting <S%H5769><s%>, thou art God <S%H410><s%>.
Thou turnest <S%H7725><s%> man <S%H582><s%> to destruction <S%H1793><s%>, And sayest <S%H559><s%>, Return <S%H7725><s%>, ye children <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%>.

For a thousand <S%H505><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> in thy sight <S%H5869><s%> Are but as <S%H3117><s%> yesterday <S%H865><s%> when it is past <S%H5674><s%>, And as a watch <S%H821><s%> in the night <S%H3915><s%>.
Thou carriest them away as with a flood <S%H2229><s%>; they are as a sleep <S%H8142><s%>: In the morning <S%H1242><s%> they are like grass <S%H2682><s%> which groweth up <S%H2498><s%>.
In the morning <S%H1242><s%> it flourisheth <S%H6692><s%>, and groweth up <S%H2498><s%>; In the evening <S%H6153><s%> it is cut down <S%H4135><s%>, and withereth <S%H3001><s%>.
For we are consumed <S%H3615><s%> in thine anger <S%H639><s%>, And in thy wrath <S%H2534><s%> are we troubled <S%H926><s%>.
Thou hast set <S%H7896><s%> our iniquities <S%H5771><s%> before thee <S%H5956><s%>, Our secret sins in the light <S%H3974><s%> of thy countenance <S%H6440><s%>.
For all our days <S%H3117><s%> are passed away <S%H6437><s%> in thy wrath <S%H5678><s%>: We bring <S%H3615><s%> our years <S%H8141><s%> to an end as a sigh <S%H1899><s%>.

The days <S%H3117><s%> of our years <S%H8141><s%> are threescore <S%H7657><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> and ten <S%H7657><s%>, Or even by reason of strength <S%H1369><s%> fourscore <S%H8084><s%> years <S%H8141><s%>; Yet is their pride <S%H7296><s%> but labor <S%H5999><s%> and sorrow <S%H205><s%>; For it is soon <S%H2440><s%> gone <S%H1468><s%>, and we fly away <S%H5774><s%>.
Who knoweth <S%H3045><s%> the power <S%H5797><s%> of thine anger <S%H639><s%>, And thy wrath <S%H5678><s%> according to the fear that is due unto thee <S%H3374><s%>?
So teach <S%H3045><s%> us to number <S%H4487><s%> our days <S%H3117><s%>, That we may get <S%H935><s%> us a heart <S%H3824><s%> of wisdom <S%H2451><s%>.
Return <S%H7725><s%>, O Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>; How long <S%H5162><s%>? And let it repent thee concerning thy servants <S%H5650><s%>.
Oh satisfy <S%H7646><s%> us in the morning <S%H1242><s%> with thy lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%>, That we may rejoice <S%H7442><s%> and be glad <S%H8055><s%> all our days <S%H3117><s%>.
Make us glad <S%H8055><s%> according to the days <S%H3117><s%> wherein thou hast afflicted <S%H6031><s%> us <S%H8141><s%>, And the years wherein we have seen <S%H7200><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%>.
Let thy work <S%H6467><s%> appear <S%H7200><s%> unto thy servants <S%H5650><s%>, And thy glory <S%H1926><s%> upon their children <S%H1121><s%>.

And let the favor <S%H5278><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> our God <S%H430><s%> be upon us <S%H3559><s%>; And establish thou the work <S%H4639><s%> of our hands <S%H3027><s%> upon us <S%H4639><s%>; Yea, the work of our hands <S%H3027><s%> establish thou it <S%H3559><s%>.
